description: This Java class defines a shell component for mocking CPE hardware abstraction layer (HAL) behaviors in a testing environment. It provides shell commands to simulate tampering, battery issues, and power removal on CPE devices via the MockCPEHal utility.

classes.name: MockCPEHalShell
classes.description: A Spring Shell component that exposes commands to simulate various hardware states of a CPE device for testing purposes.

methods.name: cpeTamper
methods.description: Simulates tampering with the CPE hardware.

methods.name: cpeTamperRestore
methods.description: Restores the CPE hardware tampering state to normal.

methods.name: cpeBatteryBad
methods.description: Simulates a bad battery condition on the CPE.

methods.name: cpeBatteryBadRestore
methods.description: Restores the battery to a good condition on the CPE.

methods.name: cpeBatteryLow
methods.description: Simulates a low battery condition on the CPE.

methods.name: cpeBatteryLowRestore
methods.description: Restores the battery to normal levels on the CPE.

methods.name: cpeAcPowerMissing
methods.description: Simulates removal of AC power from the CPE.

methods.name: cpeAcPowerRestored
methods.description: Restores the AC power to the CPE.
